title: Dead code detection and removal
description: Run Go's deadcode tool (golang.org/x/tools/cmd/deadcode) and go vet to identify unused functions, methods, types, constants, and variables across the codebase. Remove all confirmed dead code. This is particularly valuable after the service.go refactor in sprint-003, which may have left orphaned helpers or types. Also addresses the getCurrentWeekDateRange method already identified as unused in service.go.
acceptance_criteria: deadcode tool reports zero unreachable functions
go vet reports no unused variables, imports, or assignments
getCurrentWeekDateRange removed from service.go (already confirmed unused)
No unused types, constants, or struct fields remain
No unused function parameters that can be safely removed
Application builds successfully after all removals
All existing routes and functionality still work

known_dead_code: service.go: getCurrentWeekDateRange() - confirmed unused, only defined never called
approach: 1. Run deadcode tool and capture full report
2. Run go vet ./... and capture findings
3. Review each finding - some may be intentionally exported for future use
4. Remove confirmed dead code, keeping exported API methods that form a logical public interface
5. Verify build after each batch of removals
6. Run deadcode again to confirm clean
caution: Exported methods may be used by templates via reflection - verify before removing
Handler methods registered via HandleFunc may not show as called in static analysis
Repository interface implementations may appear unused but are needed

testing_requirements: All admin pages still load correctly
All player-facing pages still load correctly

context.user_story: As a developer, I want dead code removed so the codebase only contains code that is actually used, making it easier to understand and maintain
